Package co.cookies.sdk

Class CookiesSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cookies.sdk.CookiesSDK
  • @Immutable
@ThreadSafe
public final class CookiesSDK
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the main facade for acquiring a CookiesSDKManager, via builder().

    Build SDK managers are immutable, and any bound services spawned from one adopt the settings provided by the user to the original builder, as applicable.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        @Nonnull
public static CookiesSDKManager.Builder builder()
        Acquire a fresh builder which can be used to acquire an instance of CookiesSDKManager.

        Using the builder methods at CookiesSDKManager.Builder, invoking developers can customize such things as the executor, logging tools, credentials, and keys used across services. After building the manager, the resulting object is immutable and may safely be used from multiple threads.

        Returns:
        Fresh, defaults-only builder for an SDK manager.

      • sync

        @Nonnull
public static <R extends com.google.protobuf.Message> SyncRPC<R> sync​(@Nonnull
                                                                      R request)
        Wrap a request in a synchronous (blocking) RPC operation, where the response is returned directly to invoking code, which waits until any activity completes before returning.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Request message type.
        Parameters:
        request - RPC request to wrap.
        Returns:
        Synchronous RPC wrapper, which can be passed to an RPC method.

      • async

        @Nonnull
public static <R extends com.google.protobuf.Message> AsyncRPC<R> async​(@Nonnull
                                                                        R request)
        Wrap a request in an asynchronous (non-blocking) RPC operation, where a future value container is returned in lieu of a response, which eventually either resolves to a return result or an error.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Request message type.
        Parameters:
        request - RPC request to wrap.
        Returns:
        Async RPC wrapper, which can be passed to an RPC method.
